CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper November 15, 1958, pg, 6, reads: "Spanish War Vets - At the dedication on Veteran's Day of the plaque at the Courthouse commemorating the chartering of the Veterans of Foreign Wars, 44 years ago in Pittsburgh, were these three of a force of the U. S. forces who fought in the Spanish-American War. They are, left to right: William L. Porter, 633 Duff St.; Benjamin T. Frazier, 410 Armandale St.; and Ernest G. Brightful, 1250 Columbus Ave., all members of Sgt. Carney Post, who served with the troops in the war against Spain. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Spanish American War Veterans William L. Porter, Benjamin T. Frazier, and Ernest G. Brightful posed next to VFW plaque during its dedication, Allegheny County Courthouse
